column4: Hello all! I guess this question wont be appreciated. I am having a problem with the removal of ubuntu: cant figure out at what partition ubuntu is at. I would like to format the partition where ubuntu is located. I am using windows 7. Any tips?
<datacrusher> just google grub ubuntu windows
Anyone know how I can find out at what partition ubuntu is at? I am using windows 7.
Anyone named Anders Jackson in here?
that is something you should do from inside windows.. is the partition not showing up in explorer?
I can see all the partition on my computer, but I cant figure out which one is used by ubuntu.
try entering each on with explorer, you probably cant enter the ones used by ubuntu
I have a total of 5 partitions. One is "OS (C:)", one is "Data (D:)". The remaining three i cant open or do anything except remove.
in that case those 3 ones are probably used by ubuntu
just make suer they're not named recovery or something like that
probably as in go ahead and try or 50-50% they are used by ubuntu?
id 'go ahead and try'...
ah ok. So if I remove these I will remove ubuntu from my computeR?
have you tried wubi? https://wiki.ubuntu.com/WubiGuide
nope I have not. Is it neccessary for the removal of Ubuntu?
it should be the easieast way..
So what happens if I remove the partitions?
Sry lot of questions =)
the bootloader will reside i guess
I do not understand that. "reside"?
it means it wont be removed
OK. Thank you for anwsering all my question.
np and hope you come back to us someday :p
I probably will =)
